description.value: Your sagacity is so infallible that you have a sense when you're making a major blunder. If you're about to take a course of action that is a significant mistake leading to a bad outcome in the near future (typically one that would give a result of "bad" if you cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X] spell), you have a gut feeling that something is off. This doesn't tell you why something feels wrong or what part of a more complicated course of action is the problem. This doesn't protect you against every hypothetical bad decision that comes up casually in conversationâ€”you need to be honestly about to take the course of action to receive an automatic warning, though you can also concentrate for 1 minute on a specific hypothetical course of action to consider it carefully enough to receive a warning if the outcome was bad.
